ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Specify the timeframe (in the past year, past two weeks, etc.) in which elements/items are assessed
I was aware of different emotions that arose in me
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I tried to pay attention to pleasant and unpleasant sensations
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I found some of my experiences interesting
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed many small details of my experience
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I felt aware of what was happening inside of me
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed pleasant and unpleasant emotions
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I actively explored my experience in the moment
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I clearly physically felt what was going on in my body
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I changed my body posture and paid attention to the physical process of moving
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I felt that I was experiencing the present moment fully
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed pleasant and unpleasant thoughts
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed emotions come and go
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed various sensations caused by my surroundings (e.g., heat, coolness, the wind on my face)
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed physical sensations come and go
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I had moments when I felt alert and aware
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I felt closely connected to the present moment
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed thoughts come and go
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I felt in contact with my body
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I was aware of what was going on in my mind
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: It was interesting to see the patterns of my thinking
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: I noticed some pleasant and unpleasant physical sensations
Notes: 0 = Missing; 1= Not at all; 5 = Very Well

ElementDescription: Mind Subscale
Notes: Sum sms_1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 10, 11, 12, 15, 16, 17, 19, 20; Higher scores = higher level of mindfulness

ElementDescription: Body Subscale
Notes: Sum sms_8, 9, 13, 14, 18, 21; Higher scores = higher level of mindfulness

ElementDescription: State Mindfulness Scale Score
Notes: Sum sms_1 to sms_21; Higher scores = higher level of mindfulness
